description: Caffeinated Wardrobe is like an API for your closet. This MCP server brings programmatic wardrobe management to any MCP-compatible AI client - track clothing items, compose (and remember) outfits, analyze wear patterns, and get AI-powered styling recommendations. Combine with filesystem, calendar, or browser MCP servers for context-aware outfit suggestions based on your schedule, weather, or recent purchases.

capabilities.name: list_tags
capabilities.description: Get all unique tags used by the current user for their items.

capabilities.name: create_item
capabilities.description:
Create a new wardrobe item.

For brands, colors, and stores, you can provide either the name or ID:
- brand: "Nike" (auto-creates if not found) OR brand_id: UUID
- color: "Blue" (auto-creates if not found) OR color_id: UUID
- store: "Amazon" (auto-creates if not found) OR store_id: UUID

You can also provide image_urls to upload images from publicly accessible URLs.
Images will be uploaded after the item is created. If any image URLs fail to upload,
the item will still be created successfully.

No need to check if brands/colors/stores exist first - the system handles this automatically.

capabilities.name: list_items
capabilities.description: Get a list of all wardrobe items with reduced details for MCP efficiency.

capabilities.name: get_item_details
capabilities.description: Get details of a specific wardrobe item.

capabilities.name: update_existing_item
capabilities.description:
Update an existing wardrobe item.

For brands, colors, and stores, you can provide either the name or ID:
- brand: "Nike" (auto-creates if not found) OR brand_id: UUID
- color: "Blue" (auto-creates if not found) OR color_id: UUID
- store: "Amazon" (auto-creates if not found) OR store_id: UUID

You can also provide image_urls to upload images from publicly accessible URLs.
Images will be uploaded after the item is updated. If any image URLs fail to upload,
the item will still be updated successfully.

No need to check if brands/colors/stores exist first - the system handles this automatically.

capabilities.name: delete_item
capabilities.description: Delete a wardrobe item.

capabilities.name: upload_images_from_urls
capabilities.description: Upload images for a specific wardrobe item from URLs. Designed for MCP tools to avoid base64 encoding overhead.

capabilities.name: delete_image
capabilities.description: Delete an image associated with a specific wardrobe item.

capabilities.name: set_default_image
capabilities.description: Set a specific image as the default for a wardrobe item.

capabilities.name: get_related_items
capabilities.description: Get all items that are related to the specified item.

capabilities.name: create_item_relationship
capabilities.description: Create a new relationship between two items.

capabilities.name: delete_item_relationship
capabilities.description: Delete a relationship between two items.

capabilities.name: get_item_wear_history
capabilities.description: Get wear history for a specific item.

capabilities.name: list_outfits
capabilities.description: Get a list of all outfits.

capabilities.name: create_outfit
capabilities.description: Create a new outfit.

capabilities.name: get_outfit_details
capabilities.description: Get details of a specific outfit.

capabilities.name: update_outfit
capabilities.description:
Update an existing outfit.

When modifying the item composition of an outfit that has been worn, a new outfit
will be automatically created with the updated composition. The original outfit
and its wear history will be preserved. The response will include the new outfit
ID and a flag indicating whether a new outfit was created.

Examples:
- Updating unworn outfit composition: Returns updated outfit with new_outfit_created=False
- Updating worn outfit composition: Returns new outfit with new_outfit_created=True
- Updating outfit metadata only: Returns updated outfit with new_outfit_created=False

capabilities.name: delete_outfit
capabilities.description: Delete an existing outfit.

capabilities.name: get_outfit_wear_history
capabilities.description: Get wear history for a specific outfit.

capabilities.name: record_wear
capabilities.description: Record that an item or outfit was worn at a specific date/time. Will default to now if not provided.
